intro: Ipomoea igualensis, commonly known as the Iquique morning glory, is a species of flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in coastal regions of Peru and Chile. It is a climbing vine that produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of blue, violet, and white. The plant belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many other flowering vines and herbs. Its leaves are heart-shaped and typically have a rough texture, while its stems are hairy and woody. Ipomoea igualensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in sandy or rocky soils along the coast.
